Articles.Content:
A good way to prevent a cheaty way to stop your rotation: don't allow for time warp until you've killed the majority of your rotational speed.

Simple enough!

Edited June 17, 2014 by horndgmium

not to sound mean, but, why is this even an issue anyway? i mean does it really matter if someone uses time warp in this manner? If you want to use TW in the manner you are suggesting thats great, but why try to force that on the rest of us?

It sure feels unphysical but on the other hand sometimes it is very useful or even only available tool to stop ship oscillations or phantom rotation in orbits with low orbital speeds.

There's also a mod that adds that functionality.
Why would you care if someone else does this?
This would be a pest sometimes, I'd rather have something that preserves rotation, so that we can build permanently rotating stations.

I agree.

Wouldn't this, like, make any time warp (or out-of-loading-vehicle switches if you want to be really strict) impossible while near a rotating debris?
